frameDefinitions: This frame concerns rituals performed in line with religious beliefs or tradition.
A Speaker addresses an Audience on a particular Topic.
This frame contains words that describe a set of individuals which possess some Commonality, generally a common attribute.
This  frame contains words that talk about how Speakers name Entities.
An Agent causes a Patient to be affected, sometimes by a particular Means or by use of an Instrument.
A Mother and Father produce a Child or an Egg. 'Betty bore Gerry three intelligent daughters.'
frameExamples: In certain fertility <t>rites</t> in Burma , a woman desirous of offspring is required not only to approach the King Cobra but to plant a kiss on its mouth .
McNamara <t>addressed</t> congress on the state of affairs of the Department of Defense.
They drove through an area <t>nicknamed</t> Sniper's Alley
A professional dishwasher doesn't <t>do</t> dishes with a rag anymore!
listRoleDefinitions: This is the religious or cultural leader who performs and/or leads the rite.
The role <fen>Member</fen> describes the member of the religious or cultural group who participates in/undergoes the rite.
<fen>Organization</fen> identifies the institution in which the rite is prescribed.
This role identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen> used to perform a particular rite.
This role identifies the state which the rite is hoped or intended to bring about.
The type of ritual or ceremony being performed.
This role indicates an object on which a rite is performed.
Rites may confer a <fen>New_status</fen> on a participant (e.g. rank, membership).
The <fen>Guardian</fen> is the member of the <fen>Organization</fen> who instigates the rite for someone of which they are a guardian.
When the rite is performed
Where the rite takes place.
The person or persons to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> delivers their text.
The person who orally delivers a text about a <fen>Topic</fen> to a passive <fen>Audience</fen>.
What the text that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces is about.
The <fen>Time</fen> describes when the speaking occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> describes the location where the speaking occurs.

This role denotes the people in possession of the Commonality. This role is usually genetive, the object of a postnominal PP, or null instantiated (INI), and null instantiaton often implies the public at large, as in 'the common good'.
This role denotes an object or attribute which is jointly posessed by the <fen>Entities</fen>.
One of the possesors of the <fen>Commonality</fen>. Can be singular or plural.
One of the possesors of the <fen>Commonality</fen>. Can be singular or plural.
The entity that Speakers refer to by using the Name.
The linguistic expression by which Speakers refer to the Entity.
The person who uses the linguistic expression (Name) to refer to the Referent.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
This role identifies the act that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs intentionally.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional act that affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.
Patient is the entity acted on and that may, but need not, undergo a change.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> performs the intentional act.
<fen>Mother</fen> is the female creature that produces the <fen>Child</fen>.
<fen>Child</fen> identifies the new self-motile creature produced from the <fen>Mother</fen> and <fen>Father</fen>.
<fen>Father</fen> is the male creature that copulates with the <fen>Mother</fen>, thus  leading to the birth of the <fen>Child</fen>.
<fen>Egg</fen> is an immobile object containing an organism that may hatch as a mobile, infant organism.
The <fen>Mother</fen> and <fen>Father</fen> expressed together.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
listRoleExamples: His baptism <fex>into the Catholic Church</fex> is scheduled for next Sunday.
Elliott was almost ordained <fex>as a priest</fex>
<fex>Mr. and Mrs. Wilson</fex> baptized their son.
He lectured <fex>to the officers of the Scots Guard</fex>  in  1929.
<fex>You</fex> have to sermonize about the good times
He was the Director: he could lecture <fex>on whomever he liked</fex>.
Their shared <fex>parents</fex> were their only similarity.
A professional dishwasher does <fex>dishes</fex> one at a time.
Female clownfish lay <fex>their eggs</fex> around sea anemones
<fex>We</fex> are going to be having twins!

passageCandidateSpans.text: State University of New York Press
The Prince and His Lady- The Love Story of the Duke of Kent
The Affair of the Veiled Murderess: An Antebellum Scandal and Mystery
